data.title: Shahid Kapoor and Mira Rajput have moved into their new luxurious home worth over Rs 56 Crore. Here's everything you want to know about it
data.meta_description: The duplex has a piano room, stunning interiors and offers an unrestricted view of Mumbai's stunning skyline
data.text:
Bollywood actor Shahid Kapoor is currently gearing up for his digital debut as he teams up with filmmaker duo Raj and DK for Farzi. The project will also star Vijay Sethupathi, Raashi Khanna, Kay Kay Menon, and Regina Cassandra in significant roles, but the thriller series is expected to arrive on Amazon Prime Video next year.

On the personal front, Shahid and his family have finally moved into their new duplex apartment, which costed the actor approximately Rs 56 crore, with Rs 2.91 crore in stamp duty, as per NoBroker.in. Located in Mumbai's poshest area, Worli, the swanky new house spreads across 8,625 sq. ft and comes with six parking spots, offering ample space for the talented actor's fleet of super expensive wheels and a 500-square-foot spacious balcony. Shahid and Mira Rajput's duplex apartment is located on the 42nd-43rd floor of Three Sixty West, offering an unrestricted view of the city's stunning skyline.

Taking to Instagram, Mira Rajput shared a series of posts and stories, giving us all a glimpse of their new luxurious apartment. Seated in a lounge chair dressed in a white outfit, Mira posted the image from her new house and wrote, 'Who knows? Is this the start of something wonderful and new?'

That wasn't all. She also posted a video of herself playing the piano in their new spacious and lavish duplex apartment, located in South Mumbai's new skyscraper. Check out Mira Rajput's posts here:
